New Records: Virat Kohli hit his first international century since November 2019 with a maiden T20 ton for India.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar returned his T20 best of five wickets for four runs.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli stood unbeaten on 122 off 61 deliveries to power India to 212-2.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar took five wickets for four runs to help limit Afghanistan to 111-8.
KL Rahul made 62 and put on an opening stand of 119 with Virat Kohli.
Fareed Ahmad broke the century stand and bowled Suryakumar Yadav for six.
Ibrahim Zadran remained unbeaten on 64 for Afghanistan.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed surprise and joy at his century, noting it was the last format he expected to score a century in.
Kohli spoke about his mental struggles and how a month off helped him regain his intensity.
Afghanistan’s assistant coach Raees Ahmadzai praised Kohli's performance and noted the shots he played reminded him of the old Kohli.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match served as a tune-up for the T20 World Cup in October-November in Australia.
Afghanistan played their second successive day on the field after a heartbreaking loss to Pakistan on Wednesday.
Pakistan will play Sri Lanka on Friday in a dress rehearsal for the title clash on Sunday.
